TopicTitle: Ever get the feeling the VAB doesn't approve of your design

Articles.Content: I recently got this feeling after trying to stick a new row of tanks on a pancake formation. It's so tedious you just know there is some kerbal somewhere holding up the process as it defies his view of physics.
yes, wonder why it keeps trying to tell you to attach tanks rotated at weird angles while refusing to attach them properly at times.

The VAB irritates the crap out of me actually. I always seem to click and grab pieces I do not mean to -.-. Then I try to undo, and sometimes it doesn't work or sometimes it does but undoes other things as well. I think the VAB hates my designs with passion. XD

It deleted everything but the command pod on a design once, of course the ship was taking up most of the VAB and probably coulda made it to another solar system, so everything in ksp probably hated it... And it just had to be destroyed XD

I believe that the lag caused between VAB/launchpad is caused by a "Review Board" of kerbals that decide if I get to fly or not, if they don't like my design I get so much lag that I have to restart my computer.

Yes. After finally designing a craft the can (hopefully) land several base modules on Duna that actually looks good, I get the annoying bug where there are ghost parts, rendering this craft unusable unless I rebuild it.

Just now when starting to build at an asymmetric part of the rocket.

I built a rover first than built the rocket around it afterwards. Quite the stupid idea it seams, it messed up symmetry for the whole rocket and I had to do everything manually...

Oh well, I finished it anyway.
Well, if you do look closely at the scientist Kerbals running around down there, sometimes they gape up at your creation in horror, or burst out laughing at it.
I hate how it tends to forget the action keys for the duplicate parts that you place. Ditto in the SPH.

I hate how it tends to forget the action keys for the duplicate parts that you place. Ditto in the SPH.

I have had so many spaceplanes spin out because of this.

Trying to undo in the VAB.

Yeah, it sometimes removes entire sections of some complex rockets which I may build.
I grew up on Space Quest. Save early, save often

I have had so many spaceplanes spin out because of this.

Oh yeah! So many times! Another is when you place the launch clamps on the bottom of the center stack but the VAB decides that they belong on the upper stage instead the bottom stage.

Throttle up. Spacebar to launch and it's still clamped down! >_< DERP!
Oh yeah. It is the same for the space craft exchange for myself too. Cannot add parts where I want to even when it has done the same before. Dislike all the fighting with it just to build my ships.

The VAB has crappy default staging, like the launch-clamp thing. It recommended me light a set of solid boosters, and then immediately decouple them. Other times it wants to activate a engine along with the one the the stage above it:P. And when move my HUGE lower stages with symmetry on for some reason, it places the entire stage times 4 horizontally on the bottom of the upper stage, and my comp has a heart attack.
I remember early on the default staging worked 80-90% of the time, now it is more like woe to me should I forget to double check it.
And why do Vehicles in the VAB face East/West and you can see the launch pad out the open door to the east, yet when you get to the launch pad the rocket is now facing North/South!?

Rocket pirouettes.

But seriously, the VAB might give me a lot of grief, but the SPH I am convinced hates the notion of spaceplanes and has declared the construction of them an activity done only by heretics.
